titleStmt.title: Letter, James Dodds in France to Ellen Smith in Jackson, Tenn.,1919 May 29

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

availability.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

bibl.title: Letter, James Dodds in France to Ellen Smith in Jackson, Tenn.,1919 May 29

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: Will write you a few lines this evening. I am feeling fine and dandy They told us to day we were going home some time in June and of course that made me feel better than I have for some time

Will be at least 3 weeks before we can get out of here and maybe longer. I think I will be in the U.S. by July 1st but wont be home. I am sure will be at least two weeks after we land before I get home.
I will be discharged at Fort Oglethorp Ga. Will stop off in Nashville one day and night I think to see my Grandma and Uncle I have thair.
I will write you later and tell you how my moving is getting along for takes so long to go thro with all this stuff May be longer than I think before we get started.
